intro: Duguetia ulei, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or red junglefowl, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its fruits are small, round berries that contain seeds. Duguetia ulei is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
